```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE); set.seed(312)  # lucky seed
```

# Libraries 

First we'll load in the packages we need to tidy & analyze our simulation results. 

```{r, results='hide', message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(dplyr)      # data manipulation 
library(ggplot2)    # plots
library(targets)    # pipeline tools
library(paletteer)  # plot colors 
library(patchwork)  # plot combination
```

# Color Palette

We'll be doing some complex visualization, so we'll pick out a good color palette beforehand to make our code more readable & ensure that we don't run in to errors caused by the palette not being long enough. 

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
model_palette <- paletteer_d("ggsci::default_locuszoom")
```

# Data 

Now we'll load in the model results generated by running `monocle3` on the single-subject simulated datasets. Splitting by the reference dataset used, we'll load the objects & then iterate over them, pulling out the necessary metrics from each one. 

## Brain 

First the simulations from the brain reference. 

```{r}
# 100 cells 
tar_load(monocle3_res_brain_DEG_01_CELLS_100)
tar_load(monocle3_res_brain_DEG_05_CELLS_100)

tar_load(monocle3_res_brain_DEG_05_CELLS_1000)
```

We coerce the model results to a table.  

```{r}
mono_brain_metrics <- purrr::map(ls(pattern = "monocle3_res_brain*"), function(u) {
  obj <- eval(as.symbol(u))
  perf <- tibble(DATASET_NAME = u, 
                 MODEL_TYPE = "monocle3", 
                 PERCENT_DEG = paste0(obj$sim_parameters[[1]]$Prop_Dyn_Gene * 100, "%"), 
                 N_CELLS = obj$sim_parameters[[1]]$Cells, 
                 N_GENES = nrow(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]), 
                 N_PRED_DYNAMIC_GENES = sum(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall), 
                 N_TRUE_DYNAMIC_GENES = sum(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus == "Dynamic"), 
                 RUNTIME = as.numeric(obj$time_diff[[1]]), 
                 RUNTIME_UNITS = attributes(obj$time_diff[[1]])$units, 
                 MEM_USED = obj$mem_usage[[1]][1] / 1000^2,
                 MEM_UNITS = "MB", 
                 ROC_AUC = yardstick::roc_auc_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                  estimate = obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$pvalue, 
                                                  event_level = "second"), 
                 ACCURACY = yardstick::accuracy_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                    estimate = factor(ifelse(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall == 1, "Dynamic", "NotDynamic"), 
                                                                      levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic"))), 
                 SENSITIVITY = yardstick::sens_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                   estimate = factor(ifelse(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall == 1, "Dynamic", "NotDynamic"), 
                                                                     levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic"))), 
                 SPECIFICITY = yardstick::spec_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                   estimate = factor(ifelse(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall == 1, "Dynamic", "NotDynamic"), 
                                                                     levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic"))), 
                 RECALL = yardstick::recall_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                estimate = factor(ifelse(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall == 1, "Dynamic", "NotDynamic"), 
                                                                  levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic"))), 
                 PRECISION = yardstick::precision_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                      estimate = factor(ifelse(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall == 1, "Dynamic", "NotDynamic"), 
                                                                        levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic"))),
                 AUC_PR = yardstick::pr_auc_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                estimate = obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$pvalue, 
                                                event_level = "second"),
                 F_MEASURE = yardstick::f_meas_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                   estimate = factor(ifelse(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall == 1, "Dynamic", "NotDynamic"), 
                                                                           levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic"))),
                 BAL_ACCURACY = yardstick::bal_accuracy_vec(truth = factor(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                            estimate = factor(ifelse(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$gene_dynamic_overall == 1, "Dynamic", "NotDynamic"), 
                                                                                    levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic"))), 
                 NIR = mean(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]]$geneStatus == "NotDynamic"), 
                 ROC_CURVE = list(yardstick::roc_curve(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]], 
                                                       truth = factor(geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                       .estimate = pvalue, 
                                                       event_level = "second") %>% 
                                  mutate(dataset = u)), 
                 PR_CURVE = list(yardstick::pr_curve(obj$monocle3_results_tidy[[1]], 
                                                     truth = factor(geneStatus, levels = c("Dynamic", "NotDynamic")), 
                                                     .estimate = pvalue, 
                                                     event_level = "second") %>% 
                                 mutate(dataset = u)))
  rm(obj)
  return(perf)
}) %>% 
  purrr::reduce(rbind) %>% 
  mutate(RUNTIME_HOURS = case_when(RUNTIME_UNITS == "secs" ~ RUNTIME / 60^2, 
                                   RUNTIME_UNITS == "mins" ~ RUNTIME / 60, 
                                   RUNTIME_UNITS == "hours" ~ RUNTIME, 
                                   RUNTIME_UNITS == "days" ~ RUNTIME * 24, 
                                   TRUE ~ NA_real_), 
         .before = 10)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, results='hide'}
rm(list = ls(pattern = "monocle3_res_brain*")); gc(full = TRUE)
```

## Combine Metrics 

We coerce everything to a single table. 

```{r}
mono_metrics <- purrr::map(ls(pattern = "mono.*metrics"), \(x) eval(as.symbol(x))) %>% 
                purrr::reduce(rbind) %>% 
                mutate(DATASET_TYPE = "Single-subject", 
                       ALLOCATION = NA_character_, 
                       .before = 2) %>% 
                mutate(PERCENT_DEG = factor(PERCENT_DEG, levels = c("1%", "5%", "10%", "20%")), 
                       DATE_GENERATED = Sys.Date())
```

# Quality Control

We'll put together some basic performance plots here, though the bulk of the analysis of model performance will occur later. These are simply to get an idea of whether or not the models we fit are reasonable, or whether there might be an error somewhere upstream. 

## Compute Time 

```{r}
ggplot(mono_metrics, aes(x = RUNTIME_HOURS)) + 
  geom_histogram(color = "forestgreen", size = 0.5, fill = "forestgreen", alpha = 0.5) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::label_number()) + 
  labs(x = "Runtime (hours)", y = "Frequency") + 
  theme_classic(base_size = 14)
```

## Memory Usage 

```{r}
ggplot(mono_metrics, aes(x = MEM_USED)) + 
  geom_histogram(color = "forestgreen", size = 0.5, fill = "forestgreen", alpha = 0.5) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::label_comma()) + 
  labs(x = "Memory Used (MB)", y = "Frequency") + 
  theme_classic(base_size = 14)
```

## AUC-ROC 

```{r, fig.width=9}
mono_metrics %>% 
  pull(ROC_CURVE) %>% 
  purrr::reduce(rbind) %>% 
  left_join((distinct(mono_metrics, DATASET_NAME, PERCENT_DEG)), 
            by = c("dataset" = "DATASET_NAME")) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = 1 - specificity, y = sensitivity, group = dataset, color = PERCENT_DEG)) + 
  facet_wrap(~PERCENT_DEG) + 
  geom_segment(x = 0, xend = 0, y = 1, yend = 1, color = "black", linetype = "dashed", size = 1) + 
  geom_line(size = 1, alpha = 0.8) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = model_palette) + 
  labs(x = "1 - Specificity", 
      y = "Sensitivity", 
      color = "% Dynamic") + 
  theme_classic(base_size = 14) + 
  guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(linewidth = 2, alpha = 1)))
```

```{r, fig.width=9}
mono_metrics %>% 
  pull(ROC_CURVE) %>% 
  purrr::reduce(rbind) %>% 
  left_join((distinct(mono_metrics, DATASET_NAME, N_CELLS)), 
            by = c("dataset" = "DATASET_NAME")) %>% 
  mutate(N_CELLS = factor(N_CELLS)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = 1 - specificity, y = sensitivity, group = dataset, color = N_CELLS)) + 
  facet_wrap(~paste0("Cells: ", N_CELLS)) + 
  geom_segment(x = 0, xend = 0, y = 1, yend = 1, color = "black", linetype = "dashed", size = 1) + 
  geom_line(size = 1, alpha = 0.8) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = model_palette) + 
  labs(x = "1 - Specificity", 
       y = "Sensitivity", 
       color = "Cells") + 
  theme_classic(base_size = 14) + 
  guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(linewidth = 2, alpha = 1)))
```

## Other Classification Metrics 

When interpreting threshold-based metrics like this, it's important to keep in mind that the no information rate for many of these datasets is very high. 

```{r}
select(mono_metrics, 
       DATASET_NAME, ACCURACY, SENSITIVITY, SPECIFICITY, ROC_AUC, PRECISION, RECALL, AUC_PR, F_MEASURE, BAL_ACCURACY, NIR) %>% 
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = !DATASET_NAME, names_to = "METRIC", values_to = "VALUE") %>% 
  with_groups(METRIC, 
              summarise, 
              mu = mean(VALUE, na.rm = TRUE), 
              sd = sd(VALUE, na.rm = TRUE), 
              med = median(VALUE, na.rm = TRUE), 
              min = min(VALUE, na.rm = TRUE), 
              max = max(VALUE, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  mutate(range = paste0("(", round(min, 2), ", ", round(max, 2), ")"), 
         across(where(is.numeric), round, digits = 2), 
         METRIC = snakecase::to_title_case(METRIC), 
         METRIC = case_when(METRIC == "Nir" ~ "No Information Rate", 
                            METRIC == "Roc Auc" ~ "AUC-ROC", 
                            METRIC == "Auc Pr" ~ "AUC-PR", 
                            METRIC == "F Measure" ~ "F-measure", 
                            METRIC == "Bal Accuracy" ~ "Balanced Accuracy", 
                            TRUE ~ METRIC)) %>% 
  select(-c(min, max)) %>% 
  kableExtra::kbl(col.names = c("Metric", "Mean", "S.D.", "Median", "Range"), 
                  booktabs = TRUE, 
                  caption = paste0("n = ", length(unique(mono_metrics$DATASET_NAME)))) %>% 
  kableExtra::kable_classic(full_width = FALSE)
```
